issues.description: The template’s addGuestStudents method signature includes an extra boolean parameter (`validateInput`) that does not match the problem statement or the solution, both of which expect a single int parameter. Students following the spec will be unable to implement the correct method signature or pass the provided tests.
issues.suggested_fix: Change the template’s method signature to `public void addGuestStudents(int numberOfNewGuestStudents)` (remove the `boolean validateInput` parameter) so it aligns with the problem description and the reference solution.

issues.description: The template stub for addGuestStudents defines a different method signature (addGuestStudents(int, boolean)) than specified in the problem statement and implemented in the solution (addGuestStudents(int)). This mismatch will confuse students about which method signature to implement.
issues.suggested_fix: In the template, change the method signature from public void addGuestStudents(int numberOfNewGuestStudents, boolean validateInput) to public void addGuestStudents(int numberOfNewGuestStudents) so it matches the problem specification and the solution implementation.
